type.name: Form
type.summary: Represents a form the type of which is either unknown, unsupported or unresolved. To convert an unknown form to a specific form use the appropriate extension method. Properties and methods provided by this class are available to all forms.

property.name: EditorId
property.summary: Gets or sets the Editor ID associated with this form.

property.name: FormId
property.summary: Gets the Form ID associated with this form.

method.name: HasTag
method.summary: Determines whether this form has been tagged with the specified text.

method.name: Tag
method.summary: Tags this form with the specified text.

method.name: AsAlch
method.summary: Converts this form to a Potion form or returns null if this form is not a Potion form.

method.name: AsArmo
method.summary: Converts this form to an Armor form or returns null if this form is not an Armor.

method.name: AsCobj
method.summary: Converts this form to a Constructible Object form or returns null if this form is not a Constructible Object.

method.name: AsFlst
method.summary: Converts this form to a Form List form or returns null if this form is not a Form List.

method.name: AsGlob
method.summary: Converts this form to a Global Variable form or returns null if this form is not a Global Variable.

method.name: AsGmst
method.summary: Converts this form to a Game Setting form or returns null if this form is not a Game Setting.

method.name: AsKywd
method.summary: Converts this form to a Keyword form or returns null if this form is not a Keyword.

method.name: AsStat
method.summary: Converts this form to a Static form or returns null if this form is not a Static.

remarks.p: When a variable refers to an unknown or generic form it means that only the common form properties and methods are available. In order to access all properties of the form the variable must be cast to the specific form using the appropriate extension method.
Unknow or generic forms can be retrieved via the helper method Forms.Find() or by iterating a mixed such as the collection of forms associated with a Form List form.

Unsupported forms are forms that have been loaded but the appliaction does not know anything about such form. Unsupported forms can be assigned to properties of supported forms or added to mixed . Unsupported forms cannot be converted to a specific form.

Unresolved forms are threaded the same way unsupported forms are treated, except that their Editor ID is always null. Unresolved forms come about from references to forms that do not exist due to an error in a plugin, or because the tool deliberately skipped these forms while loading plugin. Saving plugin that reference unresolved forms will produce a warning, but will work as intended as long as the form really exists.
